The far reaching depth and knowledge of Francesco Clemente’s engagement with India’s spiritual, cultural, and visual contemporaneity informs the landscape of his rich, lyrical and symbolic imagery. Inspired by contemplative traditions, of both East and West, his practice finds poetic resonance in themes of spirituality and mysticism and the exploration of identity and self. 

 

The work’s title alludes to the 11th century Tibetan Buddhist poet Milarepa, whose profound story of anguish, perseverance and enlightenment offers wisdom on the teachings of the nature of impermanence and suffering. As auras of bold, sumptuous color fade from chartreuse, terra-cotta, and coral to emerald, indigo, and back, the acoustic phenomenon of a ringing bell and its reverberating pulsations induce a hypnotic, meditative quality. A flock of birds descend around a heart that is punctured and porous. A flag flutters in the sky. Its wooden stake pierces the heart as a enigmatic symbol of surrender. Drawing upon the influence of ancient tantric practices that unite temporalities of physical and spiritual consciousness, Clemente reflects upon the paradox of defeat. He ponders the nature of the mind and the will of human emotion to both hold and protect or release and succumb to the possibilities of an inner phenomenon, such as a metaphysical experience or journey toward inner peace, to an awakening that manifests something greater than oneself. 

 

The audio recording of Tibetan singing bowls is performed by Demo Rinpoche of the Jewel Heart Center in Michigan, a personal friend of the artist.

 

The buyer of Milarepa's Dream will have the opportunity to sit for a portrait with the artist and receive the final watercolor painting. Francesco Clemente is famed for his portraits of cultural luminaries -- from legendary writers like Allen Ginsberg and Salman Rushdie and Toni Morrison, to supermodels like Christy Turlington, to fellow artists like Jean-Michel Basquiat. Redeemable within one year of purchase. Terms & conditions apply.
